title: Extract Any Web Data in Minutes — No Selectors, No Code. Act now to outpace site changes with AI that adapts for you.
subtitle: Stop wrestling with brittle CSS/XPath, blocked requests, and messy HTML. Describe the data you want in plain English (“product name, price, rating”), and our AI finds and extracts it across changing layouts—so you launch faster, maintain less, and scale with confidence.

features.title: Tell it what you want, not how to get it
features.description: Skip CSS and XPath. Type natural-language prompts like “grab product name, price, rating, and image URL” and get a clean dataset—no technical setup required.

features.title: Resilient to layout changes
features.description: When pages shift, your scrapes shouldn’t break. Our AI understands patterns, not just selectors—cut maintenance hours and keep data flowing even as sites evolve.

features.title: Built for the modern web
features.description: Navigate dynamic sites, pagination, infinite scroll, and content behind logins using secure browser automation and smart throttling for human-like behavior.

features.title: From raw pages to ready-to-use data
features.description: Automatically structure and validate results, dedupe entries, and export to CSV, JSON, Google Sheets, webhooks, or your database via API.

features.title: Schedule, monitor, and scale
features.description: Run on a schedule, trigger via API, and get alerts on failures. Horizontal scaling handles small projects to large crawls without babysitting.

features.title: Compliance and privacy by design
features.description: Respect site rules you configure, manage credentials securely, and maintain auditable runs. Encryption in transit and at rest keeps your data safe.

testimonials.name: Maya R.
testimonials.quote: We went from days of selector-tweaking to launching new scrapes in under an hour. The AI survived multiple site redesigns without touching a thing.

testimonials.name: Daniel K.
testimonials.quote: Accuracy was shockingly good. We dropped maintenance by ~80% and finally scaled to millions of rows without constant breakage.

testimonials.name: Lena P.
testimonials.quote: I don’t code and still shipped a production-grade price tracker over a weekend. The scheduling and Sheets export are lifesavers.

faqs.question: How is this different from traditional web scrapers?
faqs.answer: Traditional tools rely on fragile CSS/XPath selectors that break when layouts change. Our AI understands the content you want (e.g., product name, price, rating) and adapts across different templates and redesigns—so you spend less time fixing and more time shipping.

faqs.question: Do I need coding skills to use this?
faqs.answer: No. Describe your target data in plain English, paste URLs, and click run. For power users, low‑code options let you chain steps, add conditions, or integrate with your stack via API and webhooks.

faqs.question: Can it handle dynamic sites, logins, and pagination?
faqs.answer: Yes. We use secure browser automation to render JavaScript-heavy pages, manage sessions, handle infinite scroll, follow pagination, and access authenticated areas you provide credentials for.

faqs.question: Is web scraping legal and compliant?
faqs.answer: Scraping legality depends on the site and jurisdiction. We provide controls to respect robots.txt and rate limits you configure, credential vaults, and audit logs. Always review a site’s terms and consult counsel for your specific use case.

faqs.question: How accurate is the AI, and what if it gets something wrong?
faqs.answer: Most users see high field‑match accuracy out of the box. You can guide the AI with examples, enforce validation rules, and use review workflows to catch edge cases. Retries and auto‑corrections improve results over time.

about: We’re a team of data engineers and ML practitioners who’ve spent years building large‑scale crawlers and pipelines for analytics, pricing intelligence, and market research. After watching teams burn time on brittle selectors and constant fixes, we built an AI‑first approach that lets anyone turn web pages into structured, reliable datasets—fast. Our platform combines enterprise‑grade browser automation, modern LLMs, and battle‑tested infrastructure to deliver accuracy, resilience, and scale without the usual complexity.

seo.meta_description: AI web scraping that adapts to site changes—no code, no selectors. Describe data in plain English and our data extraction platform bypasses brittle CSS/XPath.
seo.og_title: Extract Any Web Data in Minutes — No Selectors, No Code
seo.og_description: Stop wrestling with brittle CSS/XPath and blocked requests. Describe the data you need ("product name, price, rating") and our AI web scraping platform adapts to changing layouts—so you launch faster, maintain less, and scale with confidence.

visual_mood.target_emotion: Confidence to start extracting data today, with curiosity about AI-assisted power and ease.

design.typography_style:
Use a modern, highly readable sans for general audiences plus a monospaced font for technical elements.
- Headings: Space Grotesk or Sora (600–700 weight) for a contemporary tech feel without being intimidating.
- Body: Inter or IBM Plex Sans (400–500) for excellent legibility across UI and docs.
- Code/UI values: JetBrains Mono or IBM Plex Mono for selectors, JSON, and examples.
- Base sizes: 16–18 px body; 1.25–1.5 line-height; scale 1.125 for responsive type.
- Use tabular numerals for metrics and pricing tables.
- Ensure WCAG AA contrast; avoid ultra-light weights for critical copy.
design.layout_approach:
Structure for conversion, clarity, and convention in AI/data tools:
1) Hero (above the fold)
- Clear promise: “AI‑Powered Web Data Extraction — turn any website into structured data.”
- Short subhead: emphasize no-code/low-code and compliance.
- Primary CTA (accent): “Start free” and secondary CTA (ghost): “Watch 60‑sec demo”.
- Trust signals: customer logos, rating badges, and quick stats (e.g., jobs run, success rate).
- Optional code-free visual: a simple flow from URL → AI → CSV/JSON/Sheet.

2) Social proof & outcomes
- Short testimonial carousel with role labels (PM, Analyst, Engineer) to appeal to a general audience.
- Real metrics (time saved, accuracy) with tabular numerals.

3) How it works (3–4 steps)
- Stepper cards: Enter URL(s) → Choose template/AI extractor → Preview & clean → Schedule & export.
- Inline micro-demos or GIFs (<8s, with reduced-motion support).

4) Templates & connectors
- Searchable template grid (e.g., ecommerce product list, job posts, news articles).
- Integrations: Google Sheets, CSV/JSON, API, Zapier/Make/n8n, BigQuery/Snowflake; show logos.

5) Live playground/interactive demo
- Paste a URL, run a safe sample extraction, preview table/JSON, then gate export behind signup.

6) Compliance & ethics section
- Plain-language notes on respecting robots.txt, ToS, and consent; link to policy and legal FAQ.
- Security: encryption, audit logs, role-based access, data residency; status page link.

7) Pricing
- Simple tiers with clear usage caps (pages/month, concurrent runs, retention, proxies).
- Toggle monthly/annual, money-back or free trial clarity; comparison checklist.

8) FAQ + Docs
- Expanders for common barriers (CAPTCHAs, pagination, anti‑bot, dynamic content, rate limits).
- Prominent docs/search; “copy snippet” buttons for API examples.

9) Footer
- Legal, Privacy, Terms, Compliance, DPA, SOC/ISO (if applicable), status, contact.

Global patterns
- Sticky top nav with anchored CTAs; highlight Docs and Pricing.
- Onboarding modal after signup: 3-step checklist and a sample project wizard.
- Empty states: educational with templates and a short video.
- Performance: skeleton loaders for tables; optimistic UI for job queue.
- Offer dark mode; remember preference.

Conversion principles baked in
- One primary action per screen; secondary de-emphasized.
- Frictionless signup (email + SSO); progressive profiling later.
- Risk-reversal (free tier, no credit card if possible, transparent limits).
- Urgency without pressure: “X free runs left this month” in-app.
- Contextual proof near CTAs (logos, testimonials, quick stats).
design.imagery_style:
Data-first, minimal, and credible.
- Use clean UI mockups and short micro-demos over abstract art.
- Diagrammatic illustrations of flows (URL → AI model → structured table → export).
- Light 3D geometric shapes or isometric nodes are acceptable but secondary to real previews.
- Show real outputs: tables, JSON viewers, field mappers. Provide zoomable, high-DPI screenshots.
- Iconography: simple line/duotone with clear metaphors (selector, schedule, export, API).
- Avoid hacker/terminal clichés; prefer bright, professional environments with diverse users.
ui_elements: Primary CTA button in accent (#F59E0B) with strong contrast and large hit area (min 44x44px)
Secondary CTA as ghost or outline using primary (#2563EB)
Sticky global nav with clear Pricing, Templates, Docs, and Start Free
Segmented control: No-code | Low-code | API to address different user types
Template gallery with search, filters (site type, pagination, dynamic content), and tags
Interactive playground: URL input, run button, table/JSON preview, export gate
Field mapper UI (drag/drop) with AI-suggested selectors and confidence badges
Scheduler with cron presets and timezone selector
Job queue with statuses (Queued/Running/Complete/Failed) and retry actions
JSON/table viewer with copy-to-clipboard and download (CSV/JSON/Sheets)
Comparison table (vs. manual scraping, vs. competitors) with checkmarks and notes
Testimonial carousel with names, roles, and company logos
Trust badges: security, compliance notes, uptime/status link
Cookie-cutter onboarding checklist (Create project → Pick template → First run → Schedule)
Inline tooltips and ? helpers that open contextual docs
Toast notifications for success/error; non-blocking, with auto-dismiss and undo where possible
Empty states with sample data and a 60-second embedded demo
Command palette (⌘K/CTRL+K) for power users: create project, run job, open docs
In-product AI assistant for selector help and troubleshooting
Accessible form controls with visible labels, clear errors, and helpful inline validation
Dark mode toggle with saved preference; ensure contrast remains AA/AAA for text
Keyboard-accessible menus, dialogs, and steppers with focus trapping and ESC close
Loading states: skeleton rows for tables and progress bars for long extractions
Exit-intent or delayed modal offering a sandbox run or template download
Pricing CTA ribbons (Most popular) used sparingly and announced to screen readers

businessAnalysis.business_type: AI-powered web scraping and data extraction SaaS platform (no-code/low-code)
businessAnalysis.target_audience: Non-technical business users (marketers, analysts, founders) and technical users (developers, data teams) at startups, SMBs, and agencies needing web data at scale
businessAnalysis.business_model: SaaS (primarily B2B and prosumer). Tiered subscriptions with usage-based limits; pay-as-you-go overages; optional API and proxy add-ons; potential freemium/trial.
key_value_props: AI-driven auto-extraction that identifies page structures without CSS/XPath
No-code, beginner-friendly setup—“a scraper for anyone”
Handles dynamic, JavaScript-heavy sites with reliability
Integrated proxy management and IP rotation for anti-bot evasion
Cloud-based scale with scheduling, queues, and monitoring
Structured exports (CSV, JSON, Excel) plus REST API/webhooks
Prebuilt templates/recipes for popular sites to launch quickly
Data cleaning, validation, and deduplication for higher quality
Change detection and alerts for price/content monitoring
Fast time-to-value with low setup and minimal maintenance
competitive_advantages: Accessible UX that serves both non-technical users and developers in one platform
AI models that auto-adapt to layout changes, reducing brittle selectors and maintenance
All-in-one stack (rendering, proxies, anti-bot, scheduling) lowers integration burden
Library of ready-to-use site templates/flows for rapid deployment
Native integrations with spreadsheets and automation tools (e.g., Google Sheets, Airtable, Zapier) to operationalize data
Scalable cloud infrastructure with observability (logs, retries, alerts) for reliability
Compliance-oriented controls (rate limits, domain rules) to reduce risk
Flexible API enabling custom pipelines and embedding into workflows
